Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Job Description:

JPL’s Mars Public Engagement Office is seeking an intern to support the communications efforts for the Mars missions, including the Perseverance rover, Ingenuity Mars Helicopter, the Mars Sample Return mission, and the array of NASA Mars websites, which have millions of unique visits each year.

We're seeking a highly motivated student who desires a professional-level experience and has the initiative, skills, and judgment to excel at it. This is a paid internship where an intern will receive mentoring and feedback from the Mars Public Engagement team. They will receive detailed instructions on new assignments, but are expected to handle development of stories independently and effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

Responsibilities

  • Serving on the Mars Public Engagement team, responsible for writing, exhibit and materials support.
  • Writing public-friendly articles for the Mars websites involves transforming science and technology information into material suitable for readers, including those at an eight-grade level.
  • Editing, organizing and implementing the presentation of web content through a wide variety of technologies using software for graphics, animation, text, multimedia, dynamic and/or interactive content presentation.
  • Analyzing web and social media trends and working closely with the Mars Public Engagement team to advance NASA/JPL's public-facing Mars products and comply with NASA’s communications strategy.
  • Work is reviewed for accuracy and overall adequacy. Intern will seek guidance in applying applicable policies, procedures, and practices to new situations to determine appropriate action.
  • Interviews subjects in person, over the telephone, or via computer and email
  • Researches written materials, graphic and photographic materials, as well as audio and video recordings.
  • Quickly and accurately reports information, either verbally or electronically, for publication.
  • Helps produce photographs and graphics that would be helpful in supporting stories.
  • Working closely with other Mars Public Engagement team members, as well as scientists and technologists, to create highly complex and high-visibility communication products for general audiences
  • Analyze and plan highly complex content required for communication products
  • Help maintain currency and factual accuracy of content on the Mars websites
  • May be called on to help maintain Mars Public Engagement social media accounts, which includes responding to questions and requests
  • Correspond with Mars scientists and subject matter experts to resolve questions or supply additional background information for content on the Mars sites
  • Occasional travel to support professional conferences, to provide booth support and network with the wider Mars science community; and public engagement events
  • Help with the Mars monthly newsletter

Required Qualifications:

  • Must be currently enrolled at least half-time at an accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in journalism, communications, media, science writing, marketing, or related discipline. Students must have completed at least one year of college.
  • Must be able to work a minimum of 10 hours per week during the school year and full time, up to 40 hours per week, during the summer.
  • Minimum GPA 3.0.
  • Proven experience using communication tools (web, mobile, social media, print, digital and or video) to effectively communicate a message.
  • Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks with a strong attention to detail. Strong problem solving, critical thinking and analytical skills.
  • Excellent written and oral communications skills.
  • Previous outreach/web/writing experience, especially with NASA, is considered a plus.
  • Reporting skills.
  • Well-organized, detail-oriented and flexible.
  • Open to new ideas, new experiences and learning on the job.
  • Critical thinking and analytical skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated commitment to furthering the public understanding of Mars science.
  • Familiarity with current digital media trends and technology, including social media.
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills, including excellent grammar skills, and ability to work in a team environment, including the ability to brainstorm, incorporate feedback, and participate in meetings and other venues where interaction with others is crucial.
  • Ability to work under pressure, juggle multiple projects, prioritize tasks, solve problems, use critical thinking and analytical skills, and meet deadlines. 
  • Basic knowledge of content management systems. Training will be provided on the Mars CMS platforms.
  • Completed or ongoing coursework with exposure to standard communications principles, theories, concepts and techniques.
  • Proficient Microsoft Office skills.
  • Successful candidate must be punctual, detail-oriented, resourceful, and a self-motivated individual with the ability to work independently and apply judgment in planning, prioritizing, and completing tasks.

The typical hourly rate for this job in Pasadena, California depending on education level is $16.11 as a freshman, $19 as a sophomore, $22 as a junior, $25 as a senior.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
